장비

EQUIPMENT

Assume a character owns at least one outfit of normal clothes. Pick any one of the following 의류 outfits: artisan’s outfit, entertainer’s outfit, explorer’s outfit, 수도사’s outfit, peasant’s outfit, scholar’s outfit, or traveler’s outfit.

재산과 화폐

WEALTH AND MONEY

동전

COINS

The most common coin is the gold piece (gp). A gold piece is worth 10 silver pieces. Each silver piece is worth 10 copper pieces (cp). In addition to copper, silver, and gold 동전, there are also platinum pieces (pp), which are each worth 10 gp.

The standard coin weighs about a third of an ounce (fifty to the pound).

전리품 판매

SELLING LOOT

In general, a character can sell something for half its listed price.

Trade goods are the exception to the half-price rule. A trade good, in this sense, is a valuable good that can be easily exchanged almost as if it were cash itself.

무기

WEAPONS

무기 분류

WEAPON CATEGORIES

무기 are grouped into several interlocking sets of categories.

These categories pertain to what training is needed to become proficient in a weapon’s use (simple, martial, or exotic), the weapon’s usefulness either in close 전투(melee) or at a distance (ranged, which includes both thrown and projectile 무기), its relative encumbrance (빛, one-handed, or two-handed), and its size (Small, Medium, or Large).

Simple, Martial, and Exotic 무기: Anybody but a 드루이드, 수도사, 도적, or 마법사 is proficient with all simple 무기. 바바리안, 전사, 성기사, and 레인저 are proficient with all simple and all martial 무기. Characters of other classes are proficient with an assortment of mainly simple 무기 and possibly also some martial or even exotic 무기. A character who uses a weapon with which he or she is not proficient takes a –4 페널티 on 명중 굴림.

Melee and Ranged 무기: Melee 무기 are used for making melee 공격, though some of them can be thrown as well. Ranged 무기 are thrown 무기 or projectile 무기 that are not effective in melee.

Reach 무기: Glaives, guisarmes, lances, longspears, ranseurs, spiked chains, and whips are reach 무기. A reach weapon is a melee weapon that allows its wielder to strike at targets that aren’t adjacent to him or her. Most reach double the wielder’s natural reach, meaning that a typical Small or Medium wielder of such a weapon can 공격 a creature 10 feet away, but not a creature in an adjacent square. A typical Large character wielding a reach weapon of the appropriate size can 공격 a creature 15 or 20 feet away, but not adjacent creatures or creatures up to 10 feet away.

쌍날 무기: Dire flails, dwarven urgroshes, 노움 hooked 망치, 오크 double axes, quarterstaffs, and two-bladed swords are 쌍날 무기. A character can fight with both ends of a 쌍날 무기 as if fighting with two 무기, but he or she incurs all the normal 공격 페널티 associated with two-weapon 전투, just as though the character were wielding a one-handed weapon and a 빛 weapon.

The character can also choose to use a 쌍날 무기 two handed, attacking with only one end of it. A creature wielding a 쌍날 무기 in one hand can’t use it as a double weapon—only one end of the weapon can be used in any given round.

Thrown 무기: Daggers, clubs, shortspears, spears, darts, javelins, throwing axes, 빛 망치, tridents, shuriken, and nets are thrown 무기. The wielder applies his or her 근력 수정치 to 피해 dealt by thrown 무기(except for splash 무기). It is possible to throw a weapon that isn’t designed to be thrown (that is, a melee weapon that doesn’t have a numeric entry in 거리 Increment column on 표: 무기), but a character who does so takes a –4 페널티 on 명중 굴림. Throwing a 빛 or one-handed weapon is a standard action, while throwing a two-handed weapon is a full-round action. Regardless of the type of weapon, such an 공격 scores a threat only on a natural roll of 20 and deals double 피해 on a critical hit. Such a weapon has a 거리 increment of 10 feet.

Projectile 무기: 빛 crossbows, 무릿매, heavy crossbows, shortbows, composite shortbows, longbows, composite longbows, hand crossbows, and repeating crossbows are projectile 무기. Most projectile 무기 require two hands to use (see specific 무기 설명). A character gets no 근력 보너스 on 피해 rolls with a projectile weapon unless it’s a specially built composite shortbow, specially built composite longbow, or 무릿매. If the character has a 페널티 for low 근력, apply it to 피해 rolls when he or she uses a bow or a 무릿매.

Ammunition: Projectile 무기 use ammunition: arrows (for bows), 화살복제(for crossbows), or 무릿매 bullets (for 무릿매). When using a bow, a character can draw ammunition as a free action; crossbows and 무릿매 require an action for reloading. Generally speaking, ammunition that hits its target is destroyed or rendered useless, while normal ammunition that misses has a 50% chance of being destroyed or lost.

Although they are thrown 무기, shuriken are treated as ammunition for 목적 of drawing them, crafting masterwork or otherwise special versions of them (see 명품 무기), and what happens to them after they are thrown.

빛, One-Handed, and Two-Handed Melee 무기: This designation is a measure of how much effort it takes to wield a weapon in 전투. It indicates whether a melee weapon, when wielded by a character of the weapon’s size category, is considered a 빛 weapon, a one-handed weapon, or a two-handed weapon.

빛: A 빛 weapon is easier to use in one’s off hand than a one-handed weapon is, and it can be used while grappling. A 빛 weapon is used in one hand. Add the wielder’s 근력 보너스(if any) to 피해 rolls for melee 공격 with a 빛 weapon if it’s used in the primary hand, or one-half the wielder’s 근력 보너스 if it’s used in the off hand. Using two hands to wield a 빛 weapon gives no advantage on 피해; 근력 보너스 applies as though the weapon were held in the wielder’s primary hand only.

An unarmed strike is always considered a 빛 weapon.

One-Handed: A one-handed weapon can be used in either the primary hand or the off hand. Add the wielder’s 근력 보너스 to 피해 rolls for melee 공격 with a one-handed weapon if it’s used in the primary hand, or 1/2 his or her 근력 보너스 if it’s used in the off hand. If a one-handed weapon is wielded with two hands during melee 전투, add 1-1/2 times the character’s 근력 보너스 to 피해 rolls.

Two-Handed: Two hands are required to use a two-handed melee weapon effectively. Apply 1-1/2 times the character’s 근력 보너스 to 피해 rolls for melee 공격 with such a weapon.

Weapon Size: Every weapon has a size category. This designation indicates the size of the creature for which the weapon was designed.

A weapon’s size category isn’t the same as its size as an object. Instead, a weapon’s size category is keyed to the size of the intended wielder. In general, a 빛 weapon is an object two size categories smaller than the wielder, a one-handed weapon is an object one size category smaller than the wielder, and a two-handed weapon is an object of the same size category as the wielder.

Inappropriately Sized 무기: A creature can’t make optimum use of a weapon that isn’t properly sized for it. A cumulative –2 페널티 applies on 명중 굴림 for each size category of difference between the size of its intended wielder and the size of its actual wielder. If the creature isn’t proficient with the weapon a –4 nonproficiency 페널티 also applies.

The measure of how much effort it takes to use a weapon (whether the weapon is designated as a 빛, one-handed, or two-handed weapon for a particular wielder) is altered by one step for each size category of difference between the wielder’s size and the size of the creature for which the weapon was designed. If a weapon’s designation would be changed to something other than 빛, one-handed, or two-handed by this alteration, the creature can’t wield the weapon at all.

Improvised 무기: Sometimes objects not crafted to be 무기 nonetheless see use in 전투. Because such objects are not designed for this use, any creature that uses one in 전투 I considered to be nonproficient with it and takes a –4 페널티 on 명중 굴림 made with that object. To determine the size category and appropriate 피해 for an improvised weapon, compare its relative size and 피해 potential to the weapon list to find a reasonable match. An improvised weapon scores a threat on a natural roll of 20 and deals double 피해 on a critical hit. An improvised thrown weapon has a 거리 increment of 10 feet.

무기 품질

WEAPON QUALITIES

Here is the format for weapon entries (given as column headings on 표: 무기, below).

Cost: This value is the weapon’s cost in gold pieces (gp) or silver pieces (sp). The cost includes 기타 gear that goes with the weapon.

This cost is the same for a Small or Medium version of the weapon. A Large version costs twice the listed price.

피해: 피해 columns give 피해 dealt by the weapon on a successful hit. The column labeled “Dmg (S)” is for Small 무기. The column labeled “Dmg (M)” is for Medium 무기. If two 피해 거리 are given then the weapon is a 쌍날 무기. Use the second 피해 figure given for the double weapon’s extra 공격. 표: Tiny and Large Weapon 피해 gives weapon 피해 values for 무기 of those sizes.

Critical: The entry in this column notes how the weapon is used with the rules for critical hits. When your character scores a critical hit, roll 피해 two, three, or four times, as indicated by its critical multiplier (using all applicable 수정치 on each roll), and add all the results together.

Exception: Extra 피해 over and above a weapon’s normal 피해 is not multiplied when you score a critical hit.

x2: The weapon deals double 피해 on a critical hit.

x3: The weapon deals triple 피해 on a critical hit.

x3/x4: One head of this 쌍날 무기 deals triple 피해 on a critical hit. The other head deals quadruple 피해 on a critical hit.

x4: The weapon deals quadruple 피해 on a critical hit.

19–20/x2: The weapon scores a threat on a natural roll of 19 or 20 (instead of just 20) and deals double 피해 on a critical hit. (The weapon has a threat 거리 of 19–20.)

18–20/x2: The weapon scores a threat on a natural roll of 18, 19, or 20 (instead of just 20) and deals double 피해 on a critical hit. (The weapon has a threat 거리 of 18–20.)

거리 Increment: Any 공격 at less than this distance is not penalized for 거리. However, each full 거리 increment imposes a cumulative –2 페널티 on 명중 굴림. A thrown weapon has a maximum 거리 of five 거리 increments. A projectile weapon can shoot out to ten 거리 increments.

Weight: This column gives the weight of a Medium version of the weapon. Halve this number for Small 무기 and double it for Large 무기.

Type: 무기 are classified according to the type of 피해 they deal: bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing. Some 몬스터 may be resistant or immune to 공격 from certain types of 무기.

Some 무기 deal 피해 of multiple types. If a weapon is of two types, 피해 it deals is not half one type and half another; all of it is both types. Therefore, a creature would have to be immune to both types of 피해 to ignore any of 피해 from such a weapon.

In other cases, a weapon can deal either of two types of 피해. In a situation when 피해 type is significant, the wielder can choose which type of 피해 to deal with such a weapon.

Special: Some 무기 have special features. See 무기 설명 for details.

무기 found on 표: 무기 that have special options for the wielder (“you”) are described below. Splash 무기 are described under 특수 물질과 아이템.

Arrows: An arrow used as a melee weapon is treated as a 빛 improvised weapon (–4 페널티 on 명중 굴림) and deals 피해 as a dagger of its size (critical multiplier x2). Arrows come in a leather quiver that holds 20 arrows. An arrow that hits its target is destroyed; one that misses has a 50% chance of being destroyed or lost.

Axe, 오크 Double: An 오크 double axe is a 쌍날 무기. You can fight with it as if fighting with two 무기, but if you do, you incur all the normal 공격 페널티 associated with fighting with two 무기, just as if you were using a one-handed weapon and a 빛 weapon.

A creature wielding an 오크 double axe in one hand can’t use it as a double weapon—only one end of the weapon can be used in any given round.

Bolas: You can use this weapon to make a ranged 넘어뜨리기 공격 against an opponent. You can’t be tripped during your own 넘어뜨리기 attempt when using a set of bolas.

화살복제: A crossbow 화살복제 used as a melee weapon is treated as a 빛 improvised weapon (–4 페널티 on 명중 굴림) and deals 피해 as a dagger of its size (crit x2). 화살복제 come in a wooden case that holds 10 화살복제 (or 5, for a repeating crossbow). A 화살복제 that hits its target is destroyed; one that misses has a 50% chance of being destroyed or lost.

Bullets, 무릿매: Bullets come in a leather pouch that holds 10 bullets. A bullet that hits its target is destroyed; one that misses has a 50% chance of being destroyed or lost.

Chain, Spiked: A spiked chain has reach, so you can strike opponents 10 feet away with it. In addition, unlike most other 무기 with reach, it can be used against an adjacent foe.

You can make 넘어뜨리기 공격 with the chain. If you are tripped during your own 넘어뜨리기 attempt, you can drop the chain to avoid being tripped.

When using a spiked chain, you get a +2 보너스 on opposed 명중 굴림 made to 무장해제 an opponent (including the roll to avoid being disarmed if such an attempt fails).

You can use 무기 기교 feat to apply your 민첩 수정치 instead of your 근력 수정치 to 명중 굴림 with a spiked chain sized for you, even though it isn’t a 빛 weapon for you.

Crossbow, Hand: You can draw a hand crossbow back by hand. Loading a hand crossbow is a 이동 action that provokes 기회 공격.

You can shoot, but not load, a hand crossbow with one hand at no 페널티. You can shoot a hand crossbow with each hand, but you take 페널티 on 명중 굴림 as if attacking with two 빛 무기.

Crossbow, Heavy: You draw a heavy crossbow back by turning a small winch. Loading a heavy crossbow is a full-round action that provokes 기회 공격.

Normally, operating a heavy crossbow requires two hands. However, you can shoot, but not load, a heavy crossbow with one hand at a –4 페널티 on 명중 굴림. You can shoot a heavy crossbow with each hand, but you take 페널티 on 명중 굴림 as if attacking with two one-handed 무기. This 페널티 is cumulative with the 페널티 for one-handed firing.

Crossbow, 빛: You draw a 빛 crossbow back by pulling a lever. Loading a 빛 crossbow is a 이동 action that provokes 기회 공격.

Normally, operating a 빛 crossbow requires two hands. However, you can shoot, but not load, a 빛 crossbow with one hand at a –2 페널티 on 명중 굴림. You can shoot a 빛 crossbow with each hand, but you take a 페널티 on 명중 굴림 as if attacking with two 빛 무기. This 페널티 is cumulative with 페널티 for one-handed firing.

Crossbow, Repeating: The repeating crossbow (whether heavy or 빛) holds 5 crossbow 화살복제. As long as it holds 화살복제, you can reload it by pulling the reloading lever (a free action). Loading a new case of 5 화살복제 is a full-round action that provokes 기회 공격.

You can fire a repeating crossbow with one hand or fire a repeating crossbow in each hand in the same manner as you would a normal crossbow of the same size. However, you must fire the weapon with two hands in order to use the reloading lever, and you must use two hands to load a new case of 화살복제.

Caltrops: A caltrop is a four-pronged iron spike crafted so that one prong faces up no matter how the caltrop comes to rest. You scatter caltrops on the ground in the hope that your enemies step on them or are at least forced to 감속화 down to avoid them. One 2- pound bag of caltrops 엄폐 an 범위 5 feet square.

If the creature is wearing shoes or other footwear, it gets a +2 갑옷 보너스 to AC. If the caltrops succeed on 공격, the creature has stepped on one. The caltrop deals 1 point of 피해, and the creature’s 속도 is reduced by one-half because its foot is wounded. This 이동 페널티 lasts for 24 hours, or until the creature is successfully treated with a DC 15 치료 check, or until it receives at least 1 point of magical curing. A charging or running creature must immediately stop if it steps on a caltrop. Any creature moving at half 속도 or slower can pick its way through a bed of caltrops with no trouble.

SPECIAL SUBSTANCES AND ITEMS

Any of these substances except for the everburning torch and holy water can be made by a character with the 제작(alchemy) skill.

Acid: You can throw a flask of acid as a splash weapon. Treat this 공격 as a ranged touch 공격 with a 거리 increment of 10 feet. A direct hit deals 1d6 points of acid 피해. Every creature within 5 feet of the point where the acid hits takes 1 point of acid 피해 from the splash.

Alchemist’s Fire: You can throw a flask of alchemist’s fire as a splash weapon. Treat this 공격 as a ranged touch 공격 with a 거리 increment of 10 feet.

A direct hit deals 1d6 points of fire 피해. Every creature within 5 feet of the point where the flask hits takes 1 point of fire 피해 from the splash. On the round following a direct hit, the target takes an additional 1d6 points of 피해. If desired, the target can use a full-round action to attempt to extinguish the flames before taking this additional 피해. Extinguishing the flames requires a DC 15 Reflex save. Rolling on the ground provides the target a +2 보너스 on the save. Leaping into a lake or magically extinguishing the flames automatically smothers the fire.

Antitoxin: If you drink antitoxin, you get a +5 alchemical 보너스 on Fortitude 내성 굴림 against 독 for 1 hour.

Everburning Torch: This otherwise normal torch has a 지속적인 불꽃 spell cast upon it. An everburning torch clearly illuminates a 20-foot radius and provides shadowy illumination out to a 40-foot radius.

Holy Water: Holy water 피해 undead creatures and evil outsiders almost as if it were acid. A flask of holy water can be thrown as a splash weapon.

SPELLCASTING AND SERVICES

Sometimes the best solution for a problem is to hire someone else to take care of it.

Coach Cab: The price given is for a 탑승 in a coach that 운송수단 people (and 빛 cargo) between towns. For a 탑승 in a cab that 운송수단 passengers within a city, 1 copper piece usually takes you anywhere you need to go.

Spell: The indicated amount is how much it costs to get a spellcaster to 주문 시전 for you. This cost assumes that you can go to the spellcaster and have the spell cast at his or her convenience (generally at least 24 hours later, so that the spellcaster has time to prepare the spell in question). If you want to bring the spellcaster somewhere to 주문 시전 you need to negotiate with him or her, and the default answer is no.

The cost given is for a spell with no cost for a material component or focus component and no XP cost. If the spell includes a material component, add the cost of that component to the cost of the spell.

If the spell has a focus component (other than a 신성 focus), add 1/10 the cost of that focus to the cost of the spell. If the spell has an XP cost, add 5 gp per XP lost.

Furthermore, if a spell has dangerous consequences, the spellcaster will certainly require proof that you can and will pay for dealing with any such consequences (that is, assuming that the spellcaster even agrees to cast such a spell, which isn’t certain). In the case of 주문 that 운송수단 the caster and characters over a distance, you will likely have to pay for two castings of the spell, even if you aren’t returning with the caster.

In addition, not every town or village has a spellcaster of sufficient 레벨 to cast any spell. In general, you must travel to a small town (or larger settlement) to be reasonably assured of finding a spellcaster capable of casting 1st-레벨 주문, a large town for 2nd-레벨 주문, a small city for 3rd- or 4th-레벨 주문, a large city for 5th- or 6th-레벨 주문, and a metropolis for 7th- or 8th-레벨 주문.
